entities.departureInfo: 19 Avenue de la Bourdonnais, 75007 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Skip the notorious long lines at the Eiffel Tower and discover Paris' most famous landmark with a local and passionate guide during this engaging 90-minute tour. Your ticket includes skip-the-line access to the second level of the Eiffel Tower as well as access to the tower's summit, where you can enjoy a view of Paris' skyline from 1,063 feet above the city.

entities.name: Eiffel Tower Skip the Line and Small Group Tour with Summit Access by elevator

entities.departureInfo: Catacombs of Paris, 1 Avenue du Colonel Henri Rol-Tanguy, 75014 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Step out of Paris and into a fairytale, travelling in air-conditioned comfort to the beautiful Loire Valley. Live like French royalty for a day with a local wine tasting, and the freedom to explore three astounding châteaux. Your expert, English-speaking tour leader will entertain you between stops with insights and stories about the countryside and the nobility who once reigned over the region.

entities.name: Loire Valley Chambord & Chenonceau Castles Day Trip with Wine Tasting from Paris

entities.departureInfo: 22 Rue Jean Rey, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Think of France and what comes to mind? Chances are the Palace of Versailles and the Impressionists are up there in your top ten. However fleeting your visit, you do have time to experience a bit of both, thanks to our day trip from Paris. Ever wanted to step into one of Monet’s paintings? Your wish is our command! Wander through the lush gardens of the artist’s residence, inspiration for his Nympheas, among others. After lunch, head to Versailles, royal pad to three King Louis. From the moment you approach this imposing Palace, we dare you not to gasp at its lavish splendor. In fact, you’ll probably keep your mouth open for the rest of your visit!

entities.name: Versailles Palace & Giverny's Monet House Guided Visit with Lunch from Paris

entities.departureInfo: 24 Rue Edgar Faure, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Paris Night Bike Tour is perfect for both those new to the city and Parisian veterans. For the beginners, this tour will offer you a fantastic orientation and give you an opportunity to see virtually all of the sites you've read about. For the veterans, you will learn new facts and stories about Paris that you've never heard before. You are sure to agree that riding a bike is the best way to see the "City of Light".

entities.name: Paris by Night City of Lights Sightseeing Guided Bike Tour

entities.departureInfo: 24 Rue Edgar Faure, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: See Paris like a Parisian on a tour by bicycle! Whether it's your first or fifth time in Paris, this bike tour is the perfect way to travel from sight to sight at a leisurely pace. Getting around Paris by bicycle is the ideal orientation if you're new to Paris, and return visitors will discover new facts and hear new stories about the city they love. Either way, you are sure to agree that riding a bike is the best way to see Paris.

entities.name: Paris Sightseeing Guided Bike Tour Like a Parisian with a Local Guide

entities.departureInfo: 1: 19 Rue de Sèvres, 75006 Paris, France2: 35 Rue Rambuteau, 75004 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
Combine your love of chocolate and cakes with your passion for Paris! This delectable tour combines French gourmet specialties with a morning or afternoon walking tour so you won't need to feel too guilty.  Delight in this tasty mix of desserts, history, and culture as you discover flavor of an historic Parisian neighborhood of your choosing: either Saint-Germain-des-Prés, or the Marais. Your tour is led by an expert food and culture connoisseur, who will take you to visit a selection of pastry shops, bakeries and chocolate shops while also discovering the rich history dating back to the medieval period.

The commentary from your expert foodie guide includes history and culture of the city of Paris and of the neighborhood you visit; a description of any seasonal events taking place at the time of your tour; and an introduction to selected specialties in the main shops. Don't miss out on this tasty and informative experience!

entities.name: Paris French Sweet Gourmet Specialties Tasting Tour with Pastry & Chocolate
entities.returnInfo: 1: Saint-Germain-des-Prés, 75006 Paris, France2: Le Marais, Paris, France

entities.departureInfo: Gare Montparnasse, 17 Boulevard de Vaugirard, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
-We are amongst the few licensed to guide you inside the Château not abandon you with an audio. We mic up so you don't miss a thing!
-We visit: the Château, Royal Gardens, Fountains, Marie Antoinette's Hamlet
-We are local to Versailles, it is our home town! 
-See more with ease by bike and access places the crowds do not.

entities.name: Versailles: Food & Palace Bike Tour

entities.departureInfo: 41 Avenue de la Bourdonnais, 75007 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: See the highlights of Versailles in one day on this comprehensive trip from Paris. After traveling to the town by luxury minibus, skip past the entrance lines with your priority-access ticket and then head inside the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Palace of Versailles. Tour the State Apartments, seeing the incredible Hall of Mirrors, and then explore Versailles Gardens at leisure. Enjoy a 3-course restaurant lunch by the Grand Canal and visit the estate of Trianon with Petit Trianon and the Queen’s Hamlet.

entities.name: Versailles Best of Domain Skip-the-Line Access Day Tour with Lunch from Paris

entities.departureInfo: Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel, Place du Carrousel, 75001 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
Spend a day exploring Paris in a very unusual way. This excursion on foot and riverboat will show you the highlights of Paris: visit the Louvre Museum and the Eiffel Tower with our professional guide. 

Departure from the Arc de Triomphe du Carroussel, where you will meet your guide. He/she will take you straight to the famous Louvre Museum right opposite the Meeting Point. Your guide will take you through this must-see museum and tell you about the main artworks: the Venus of Milo and Leonardo da Vinci’s famous Mona Lisa.

After your tour of the Louvre Museum which takes about 2.30 hours, your guide will take you to the riverbank to board a Batobus boat. This short cruise will show you Paris from a different angle. 

You will have time then for lunch on your own before going up to the Eiffel Tower.

Your guide will let you disembark to go to the iconic monument of Paris. He/she will lead you up to the second floor where the secrets of the Eiffel Tower will be revealed.

entities.name: Paris in One Day with Louvre and Eiffel Tower Guided Tour plus Seine Cruise

entities.departureInfo: Place de Fontenoy, 75007 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
A 5 km Segway route with 12 points of interest (POI) in 1 hour and 15 minutes. This allows you to have a very good first glimpse of Paris if your time in the capital is limited.
Highlights: Eiffel Tower, Champ de Mars, Lavirotte building (Art Nouveau), Russian Orthodox Church, Pont de l'Alma (Zouave), Flame of Liberty, Quai de Seine, Pont Alexandre III, Petit and Grand Palais, Invalides and Military school
Disclaimer: the aim of this tour is to show you 12 of the most beautiful sites in Paris in a minimum of time (1 hour and 15 minutes!). During this 5km Segway tour, we will take souvenir photos and a quick presentation of the different monuments will be given to you. But if you wish to have a more detailed presentation of the monuments as well as the historical facts surrounding their construction during your Segway ride, we recommend that you book our 2,5 hour guided tour "the Amazing Paris Segway tour".

entities.name: Paris Segway Express Tour (12 monuments in 1 hour and 15 minutes)

entities.departureInfo: Bateaux Parisiens, Port de la Bourdonnais, 75007 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
Treat yourself to an elegant lunch in Paris with this 2-hour afternoon sightseeing cruise down the Seine River. Aboard your Bateaux Parisiens boat, relax over a 3-course French meal while enjoying music and fantastic views of Paris' most iconic attractions including the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame Cathedral, Louvre Museum and the Musée d'Orsay. A choice of seating options and wine selections are available when booking.

Information about the health pass on voucher

entities.name: Bateaux Parisiens Seine River Gourmet Lunch & Sightseeing Cruise

entities.departureInfo: 1 Avenue Emile Zola, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
Book your skip-the-line Palace of Versailles day trip from Paris and leave the long queues behind! Meet your guide in the 15th arrondissement in Paris to board the quick 30-minute train to Versailles. Take a guided tour of the Versailles Gardens and then explore the Palace at your leisure with an audio guide. This half-day Versailles tour includes round-trip train transport, a skip-the-line entrance ticket and an audio guide. 

Numbers are limited to 20 people on this small-group tour, ensuring you'll receive personalized attention from your guide. And by booking ahead, you won't waste any time waiting in line!

entities.name: Skip the Line: Versailles Palace and Gardens Day Trip from Paris by Train

entities.departureInfo: 22 Rue Jean Rey, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Expand your horizons with a day trip to medieval Mont St Michel, one of France’s most iconic attractions. This magical UNESCO World Heritage island is a step out of the ordinary with its famous Gothic abbey and legendary stories. You’ll arrive after a scenic drive from Paris through the landscapes of Normandy, with a guide to brush up on your history. There’ll be plenty of time to explore the island, admire the bay views and do a little shopping. In the winter lunch is included, from April 1st 2022 free time for lunch.

entities.name: Mont Saint-Michel Guided Day Trip with Lunch from Paris

entities.departureInfo: Place de Fontenoy, 75007 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
Discover Paris in an original way. 
The segways are self-balanced machines (more stable and easier to use than a bike or a scooter). 
In 2,5 hours by Segway, you will do the equivalent of one day of visit by foot ! You will benefit of the explanations of our French english speaking guides who will share with you their passion for Paris.
You will be in small groups and you will have time to take pictures.
Our tours are accessible from 14 years! For people of 12 and 13 years old, we ask parents to book a private tour.

entities.name: Paris: the Amazing Segway tour (Eiffel Tower and more than 20 other points of interest)

entities.departureInfo: 5 Place Blanche, 75009 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Join your friendly English speaking guide for this 2 hour walking tour in Paris' most popular neighborhood. Your guide will share stories about the the art, the music, the food and the unique history of Montmartre. You’ll soon learn why the people living here feel differently from the rest in The City of Light.

entities.name: Montmartre Walking Tour: Paris' Best Art, Culture and Food
entities.returnInfo: Sacré-Cœur, 35 Rue du Chevalier de la Barre, 75018 Paris, France

entities.departureInfo: Cité de l'architecture et du patrimoine, 1 Place du Trocadéro et du 11 Novembre, 75016 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Save time and money by booking this half-day Super Saver and enjoy a discount on two best-selling Paris tours: a Skip-the-Line Eiffel Tower visit followed by a cruise along the Seine River. Start with an informative guide commentary from Trocadéro Gardens, and with your guide’s assistance, breeze past the ticket desk line for an independent visit of the 1st and 2nd floors (continuing all the way up to the summit, if you select the option) of the Eiffel Tower, to marvel at the iconic sights from the city’s best vantage point. Then, at the time of your choosing, embark on a champagne cruise along the Seine that's chock-full of sights including the Louvre Museums, Notre Dame Cathedral and the Conciergerie.

entities.name: Eiffel Tower Tour with Summit and Seine Champagne Cruise

entities.departureInfo: Pullman Paris Tour Eiffel, 18 Avenue De Suffren, 22 Rue Jean Rey Entrée Au, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Art and splendor are on the agenda in this magical day tour from Paris, with the personal touch of a small group.  The inspirational beauty of Giverny begins your journey, with a trip to Monet’s house through the picturesque water lily gardens of his paintings, a visit of Monet's House. Authentic lunch at the charming Moulin de Fourges. The majestic splendor of Versailles Palace then awaits you, with a tour of its decadent highlights and breathtaking gardens.

entities.name: Giverny and Versailles Small Group Day Trip from Paris

entities.departureInfo: 22 Rue Jean Rey, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Majestic castles, famous wines and Renaissance masterpieces make up this unforgettable trip to the charming Loire Valley. Enjoy skip-the-line entry to Chambord then Chenonceau to be wowed by the extravagant glamor of the French aristocracy and discover their fascinating history. You’ll enjoy the machines and different invenctions made by Leonardo da Vinci in Clos Lucé Castle and its faboulus gardens.

entities.name: Loire Valley Day Trip with Chenonceau, Chambord and Cheverny Castles from Paris

entities.departureInfo: 22 Rue Jean Rey, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
Experience the grandeur of Versailles Palace and Gardens on a small group tour from Paris. With a maximum of only 15 per group, this small group trip to Versailles ensures a more intimate experience. 

An all-inclusive guided visit ! Guided visit of the State Apartments (Hall of Mirrors, King’s and Queen’s Bedroom), guided visit of the Petit and the Grand Trianons followed by Queen Marie-Antoinette’s Hamlet, created for her. Enjoy lunch (drinks included) in a restaurant near the Grand Canal. The entrance to the park of Versailles is also included!

If you visit Versailles on a Saturday or Sunday during April to October, you can see the famous fountain show in the gardens. The display is accompanied by music composed at the time of Louis XIV's court.

entities.name: Versailles Palace Small Group Gardens & Fountains Hamlet Day Trip Guided Tour

entities.departureInfo: 59 Rue du Cardinal Lemoine, 75005 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Discover traditional French cuisine and prepare your own 3-course lunch on this 4.5- or 6-hour cooking class in Paris. Begin with a visit to a food market in Paris’ Latin Quarter (6-hour class only) and select your ingredients. Then, plan your menu and cook your meal with guidance from a professional instructor. Learn tips and tricks to improve your cooking before sitting down to enjoy your meal. Sample wine from across France, and enjoy personal attention from the instructor on this small-group tour, limited to 11 people.

entities.name: Paris Cooking Class including 3-Course Lunch, Wine & Optional Market Visit
